form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Schumer introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To require all recreational vessels to have and to post passenger capacity limits and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Boating Capacity Standards Act of 2013
.

paragraph.text: The term passenger includes any individual aboard a vessel.

clause.text: manufactured or used primarily for pleasure; or
leased, rented, or chartered to a person for the pleasure of that person; and

subparagraph.text: does not include a vessel that—

clause.text: is subject to Coast Guard inspection; and

subclause.text: is engaged in commercial use; or

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commandant of the Coast Guard shall—

paragraph.text: establish standards for determining the maximum passenger capacity for recreational vessels, which shall be expressed in whole number of passengers and in pounds;
require each manufacturer of a passenger vessel to post such maximum passenger capacity on the passenger vessel in accordance with subsection (b); and
require each operator of a passenger vessel to ensure that—

subparagraph.text: such maximum passenger capacity is posted in accordance with subsection (b); and
notice of the need to balance the weight carried by the vessel to avoid capsizing is posted in accordance with subsection (b).

subsection.text: The maximum passenger capacity, maximum carrying capacity in pounds, and notice of the need to balance the carried weight for a passenger vessel—

paragraph.text: shall be permanently displayed in a legible matter; and
shall be located so as to be clearly visible to a passenger boarding the passenger vessel.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commandant of the Coast Guard shall publish regulations that establish appropriate penalties for a manufacturer of a recreational vessel that does not comply with the requirements under this section.
The requirements under this section shall apply to any recreational vessel manufactured after the date that is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
